Class BitOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      java.io.FilterOutputStream
          BitOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
public class BitOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream

Implements an enhanced OutputStream which allows you to write a stream of bit fields ranging in size from 1 bit (a true bit stream) to 32 bits (a stream of integers). The size of the current bitfield can be changed at any point while writing the stream.

BitOutputStream

public BitOutputStream(java.io.OutputStream out,
                       int bitFieldSize)
Creates a BitOutputStream with the given bitfield size which writes to the given OutputStream.

Parameters:
out - the stream to write to.
bitFieldSize - the initial size of the bitfield.
Method Detail

setBitFieldSize

public void setBitFieldSize(int bits)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the bitfield size to bits.

Parameters:
bits - The new bitFieldSize value
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bits is less than 1 or greater than 32.

getBitFieldSize

public int getBitFieldSize()
Gets the current bitfield size.

Returns:
The bitfield size.

write

public void write(int bf)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write a bitfield to the output stream. The number of bits written is the current bitfield length. Bitfield can be on arbitrary bit boundaries.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
Parameters:
bf - the value to write.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Override close() method to correctly flush any remaining bitfields in write buffer before closing output chain.

Specified by:
close in interface java.io.Closeable
Overrides:
close in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
